title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Australian researchers have pieced together the cannibalistic consumption past of the neighbouring large galaxy Andromeda and found the left-overs of smaller galaxies in large streams of stars. ANU astronomer Dougal Mackey says through studying our neighbouring galaxy, we found “Andromeda had a pretty big breakfast maybe ten billion years ago” and a “decent lunch much more recently, between two to three billion years ago”. Mr Mackey told Sky News astronomers are able to tell that these are different events because “the remains of these destroyed galaxies and are moving on different orbits around Andromeda”. According to the astronomer, Andromeda has its sights set on the Milky Way as its next main course, but it is not expected to happen for at least another four billion years. Image: Getty
